conclusion: Analyze paths from points A, B, and C to containers D and E.
Liquid starts at point A and flows downwards.
First baffle encountered from point A is black, directing liquid to the right.
Liquid from point A encounters cyan baffle, directing it downwards.
Liquid from point A encounters yellow baffle, directing it to the left.
Liquid from point A flows into container D.
Liquid starts at point B and flows downwards.
First baffle encountered from point B is black, directing liquid to the right.
Liquid from point B encounters cyan baffle, directing it downwards.
Liquid from point B encounters yellow baffle, directing it to the left.
Liquid from point B flows into container D.
Liquid starts at point C and flows downwards.
First baffle encountered from point C is pink, directing liquid to the left.
Liquid from point C encounters cyan baffle, directing it downwards.
Liquid from point C encounters yellow baffle, directing it to the right.
Liquid from point C flows into container E.
Liquid from points A and B will flow into container D; liquid from point C will flow into container E.
